newsitem.title: USA: Eastern Utilities to sell power plants.
newsitem.headline: Eastern Utilities to sell power plants.

text.p: Eastern Utilities Associates said Wednesday it agreed to sell its plants and power contracts under a settlement with Massachusetts regulators intended to bring competition to the utility industry.
The energy services company said it hired Salomon Brothers Inc as its advisor in connection with the sale of its entire portfolio of electricity-generating assets.
For sale are Eastern's interest in 12 plants with a book value of about $400 million, as well as rights to purchase power at other plants in New England, an Eastern spokesman said.
"We're going to retain our distribution and transmission assets so we will be left as a company that moves and delivers energy," he said.
Included in the assets for sale are about 1,130 megawatts of owned and contracted fossil, hydroelectric and nuclear generating capacity, the company said.
Plants range from one of the nation's oldest hydroelectric stations, Pawtucket Hydro, to Eastern's power entitlement from one of the country's newest gas-fired power plants, Ocean State Power.
